parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From kata and seio; to sway downward, i.e. Make a signal.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A hand.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Intrans: I am silent, keep silence; trans: I keep secret; pass: I am kept secret. From sige; to keep silent.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To relate in full, describe, narrate. From dia and hegeomai; to relate fully.
Adverb from the base of pou; an interrogative particle of manner; in what way?; also as exclamation, how much!
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To lead out, sometimes to death, execution. From ek and ago; to lead forth.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From phulasso; a guarding or, the act, the person; figuratively, the place, the condition, or, the time, literally or figuratively.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To report (from one place to another), bring a report, announce, declare. From apo and the base of aggelos; to announce.
The same as Iakob Graecized; Jacobus, the name of three Israelites.
And, even, also, namely.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To go out, come out. From ek and erchomai; to issue.
(a) of two: another, a second, (b) other, different, (c) one's neighbor. Of uncertain affinity; other or different.
Apparently a primary word; a spot, i.e. Location; figuratively, condition, opportunity; specially, a scabbard.
